definition: to disarm/to lay down one's weapons/to surrender
to hand in/to hand over/to seize

sentences.english: Then can seize this opportunity to, to not stable huang association army implement to disarm.
sentences.chinese: 然后可趁机，对不稳定的皇协军实施缴械。

sentences.english: Herold surrendered to the police, but Booth refused to lay down his arms and was shot dead.
sentences.chinese: 赫罗尔德向警方投降，布斯则拒绝缴械而被击毙。

sentences.english: Watching an insipid and familiarly witless England side capitulate to Spain, those other European rank underachievers ?
sentences.chinese: 去看英国队向欧洲足球的落后生西班牙队缴械投降吗？

sentences.english: The last time the Spurs have been nothing back, was forced to surrender.
sentences.chinese: 马刺最后时刻的反扑也告无功而返，被迫缴械投降。

sentences.english: There, surrounded by a belated outpouring of militia, Burgoyne surrendered ten days later.
sentences.chinese: 在那儿被民兵围困了10日后，柏戈因最终缴械投降。

sentences.english: Tobacco cravings can wear you down when you're trying to quit smoking or chewing tobacco.
sentences.chinese: 戒烟或咀嚼烟草时，你的吸烟欲望能够让你缴械投降。

sentences.english: The general told the troops to lay down their arms.
sentences.chinese: 将军告诉士兵缴械投降。

sentences.english: Her husband had tried to disarm his killer.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫当时试图让嫌犯缴械。

sentences.english: However, McAfee said the move is a sign of capitulation on the part of Microsoft.
sentences.chinese: 但McAfee表示，微软此举是缴械投降的迹象。

definition: to lay down one's arms/to surrender/to disarm
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to execute by firing squad/same as 槍斃|枪毙
hands tied and waiting to be captured
